For comparison:
{{champion:42}}  gets +10% of his AD on every auto attack all the time - since they will typically sit on around 72-80 AD at the first level (from runes in masteries) thats 7-8 damage on every auto attack right from level 1. He also has an escape, and long ranged poke, which Vayne does not.
{{champion:236}} gets +30%-50% on an auto attack after every spell cast (so 22-24 dmg roughly), which can also crit, while also having a dash, poke, and minion penetrating spells.

%of AD is typically much more powerful of a bonus than %max health, especially early game, where health totals are so low that the bonus damage is less than minion auto attacks.

I don't necessarily think % health true damage is necessarily a problem on Vayne, but rather how accessible constant procs of this true damage is. Making Vayne a champion that must commit to attacking a single target (similar to Mini Gnar) and further limiting her target selection through somewhat unimpressive attack range helps carve out her defined strengths and weaknesses, but perhaps something like increasing the number of hits required to proc that true damage to 4 (or even 5), decreasing the stack duration to make that true damage easier to avoid, or [changing Silver Bolts entirely](http://lolredesigns.blogspot.com/2013/11/champion-redesign-vayne-night-hunter.html?q=vayne) so that it forces her to sacrifice something other options for that true damage could all potentially help bring that ability more in-line.

Removing the base value does 2 things: It nerfs her overall DPS by roughly 40 (Since most Vaynes build for close to 2.0 attack speed), and in particular makes her less effective against squishy champions. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it's something you have to keep in mind. damage values are part of a kit for a reason, and just saying "She does so much damage, we should nerf this part of it!" is a sure fire way to end up ruining a champion long term after repeat nerfs of that style.

Maybe you should consider it this way: Why does Vayne get to deal so much damage? What weaknesses should be highlighted to make it fair and fun to play against her with those strengths? is there something about an item that is making her too strong or is it something internet to her kit?

For those few, most would say Vayne's short overall range and relatively lack-luster lane phase warrant having high damage, and also that BotRK is the real problem in this situation. Other than that, she is just good in the current meta because she can shred tanks and is also pretty safe against enemy assassins. If control mages and lane bully ADCs were to receive buffs, or if BotRK were to be nerfed, I would hazard a guess that Vayne would quite quickly fall out of favor pretty quickly.

TL;DR: Don't just point at parts of a kit yelling "SHE'S OP, NERF THIS PART!", instead examine the whole situation and figure out the best course of action for the health of the game as a whole.

I completely understand that she does not have poke abilities as these other champs do, but most poke abilities do not get used in later game teamfights (not the pre-fight "dance" where poke abilities are very helpful) and AAs are the depended source of damage. Considering she has 2 relatively reliable escape abilities and an extra escape/engage with her ult, I was suggesting that she is a little too safe in teamfights with her current stats than she should be. I always got the impression that it was her AA range that people were talking about being too short (which is normally a noted factor in teamfight safety... bigger AA range, further back adc can be, safer adc is). This is referring to teamfights and not ability range. Ability range-wise, she IS short range, but AA wise (in regards to teamfights) she has a relatively safe AA range, unlike Graves, Kog, and others under 550 (understand that Kog and other short range ADCs have ways to compensate for that, i.e. Kog's increased range on living artillery or early game bully potential).

TL;DR I am referring to her teamfight range, not overall... overall the poke ADCs make her range look like melee. I also am merely suggesting that, relative to her stats, she is a little too safe. This is just what I have observed.

Silver Bolts is more difficult to itemise against than it otherwise would be because it has both flat damage (which encourages health stacking) and %HP damage (which discourages it). If she only did %HP damage you would prioritise armor against her, not against Silver Bolts but against the rest of her damage. If she only had flat damage you'd get health. But when you stack armor to reduce the amount you take from her %HP, you take a bigger fraction of your health from the flat amount.

You're not supposed to itemise to counter %HP true damage, the entire point of the ability and Vayne as a champion is that tanks can't counter her W. But if they removed the flat damage you would at least be able to say "Screw it, I'll just prioritise armor to negate the rest of her damage", which is a fine idea because she does a ton more physical damage than she does true damage anyway. The problem here is that the flat damage COMBINED with the %HP damage means you're screwed either way.

In the first place, all ADC's have the option of fighting with auto attacks; access to other options such as utility, dodges, and poke are a bonus and provide the ADC additional options when simply performing auto attacks is not a realistic option. Ashe has a slow on every auto attack, long ranged poke, and a stun. Varus has a snare and %max health based magic damage, and burst. Kog'Maw has an attack range steroid, %max health magic damage steroid, attack speed steroid, and an armor/mr shred - he can out dps Vayne. These marksmen are immobile because they have powerful abilities which contribute to their damage or to the team as a whole; fortunately for them, they have a champion on every team whose whole job is making sure they stay alive.

The problem seems to be that you are looking at Vayne in a vacuum, where she's always in her best case fully built and fed and in a 1v1 scenario. Vayne as an assassin/carry is extremely specialized in 1v1 battles through high sustained auto attack damage, but she does very poorly in a scenario where she has to deal with more than one opponent at a time, since switching targets automatically resets her passive. Her range is also limited without poke, so she has to put herself at risk in order to attack an opponent.
